subject: AI
title: Train/Test Split
description: Why you must hide data from your model to trust it.

hook.text: A student peeks at the answer key before the exam and aces it. Did they actually learn the material? You'd never know.

buildup.text: Same idea: if your model trains on all the data, you can't tell if it learned real patterns or just memorized answers. You need data it's never seen.

discovery.text: Split your data: typically 80% for training, 20% for testing. The test set is the exam â€” evaluate once, honestly.

twist.text: If you tune your model repeatedly based on test results, you're indirectly leaking test data into training. Add a validation set in between for tuning.

climax.text: Three splits: train (learn), validation (tune), test (final honest score). The test set should be touched only once.

punchline.text: Never let your model study the answer key. Hold out data, or your metrics are fiction.

quiz.question: What is the purpose of a test set?
options: To give the model more training examples
To provide an honest evaluation on unseen data
